devil noun
(PERSON)
C2 [ C ] informal someone, especially a child, who behaves badly: little/young devil Those little/young devils broke my window.
[ C ] informal humorous a person who enjoys doing things people might disapprove of: "I'm going to wear a short black skirt and thigh-length boots." "Ooh, you devil!"be a devil Have another slice of cake - go on, be a devil!
[ C ] informal used with an adjective to describe someone and express your opinion about something that has happened to them: lucky devil I hear you've got a new car, you lucky devil!poor devil He's been ill for weeks, poor devil.
More examplesFewer examplesHe's a sly old devil - I wouldn't trust him with my money.André's got a new job, the lucky devil.
